# Application Icons

This directory contains the application icons for the Voice Intelligence Desktop App.

## Icon Design

The current icons feature a professional microphone design representing the voice recording functionality:
- Blue gradient background (#3B82F6 to #2563EB)
- White microphone with stand
- Sound wave decorations
- Optimized for visibility at all sizes

## Generated Files

### SVG Source Files (Vector)
- `16x16.svg` - Tiny icon
- `32x32.svg` - Small icon (Windows taskbar)
- `64x64.svg` - Medium icon
- `128x128.svg` - Standard icon
- `128x128@2x.svg` - Retina/HiDPI icon (256x256)
- `512x512.svg` - Large icon
- `icon-1024.svg` - Master icon (1024x1024)
- `icon.svg` - System tray icon

### PNG Files (Raster)
Generated from SVG files:
- `16x16.png` through `icon-1024.png`
- `icon.png` - System tray icon (128x128)

### Platform-Specific Files
Generated by Tauri CLI:
- `icon.ico` - Windows executable icon (multi-size)
- `icon.icns` - macOS bundle icon (multi-size)

## Quick Start

### Generate All Icons (Recommended)

```bash
# Generate SVG icons and convert to all formats
npm run icons:build
```

This will:
1. Generate SVG icons with microphone design
2. Convert SVG to PNG (requires sharp-cli or ImageMagick)
3. Generate platform-specific formats (.ico, .icns)

### Step-by-Step

```bash
# 1. Generate SVG icons
npm run icons:generate

# 2. Convert SVG to PNG and generate platform formats
npm run icons:convert
```

## Requirements

To convert SVG to PNG, you need one of:

### Option 1: sharp-cli (Recommended)
```bash
npm install -g sharp-cli
```

### Option 2: ImageMagick
```bash
# Linux
sudo apt-get install imagemagick

# macOS
brew install imagemagick

# Windows
# Download from https://imagemagick.org/script/download.php
```

### Option 3: Online Converters
If you don't want to install tools:
1. Upload SVG files to https://cloudconvert.com/svg-to-png
2. Download PNG files
3. Run `npm run tauri:icon icons/icon-1024.png`

## Manual Icon Generation

### Using Tauri CLI (Easiest)

```bash
# Generate all formats from a single 1024x1024 PNG
npm run tauri:icon icons/icon-1024.png
```

This automatically creates:
- All PNG sizes
- icon.ico for Windows
- icon.icns for macOS

### Using ImageMagick

```bash
cd src-tauri/icons

# Convert SVG to PNG
for file in *.svg; do
  convert "$file" "${file%.svg}.png"
done

# Generate Windows .ico (multiple sizes in one file)
convert icon-1024.png -define icon:auto-resize=256,128,64,48,32,16 icon.ico

# Generate macOS .icns (requires macOS)
mkdir icon.iconset
cp 16x16.png icon.iconset/icon_16x16.png
cp 32x32.png icon.iconset/icon_16x16@2x.png
cp 32x32.png icon.iconset/icon_32x32.png
cp 64x64.png icon.iconset/icon_32x32@2x.png
cp 128x128.png icon.iconset/icon_128x128.png
cp 128x128@2x.png icon.iconset/icon_128x128@2x.png
cp 128x128@2x.png icon.iconset/icon_256x256.png
cp 512x512.png icon.iconset/icon_256x256@2x.png
cp 512x512.png icon.iconset/icon_512x512.png
cp icon-1024.png icon.iconset/icon_512x512@2x.png
iconutil -c icns icon.iconset
```

## Design Guidelines

When creating custom icons:

### Technical Requirements
- Master icon: 1024x1024 PNG with transparency
- Use vector graphics (SVG) for scalability
- Export at multiple sizes for optimal rendering
- Test at smallest size (16x16) for clarity

### Visual Guidelines
- **Simple & Recognizable**: Icon should be identifiable at small sizes
- **High Contrast**: Ensure visibility on light and dark backgrounds
- **Avoid Fine Details**: Details disappear at small sizes
- **Consistent Style**: Match the app's visual design
- **Platform Guidelines**: Follow OS-specific icon guidelines
  - Windows: Flat, colorful, simple shapes
  - macOS: Rounded corners, subtle shadows, depth
  - Linux: Varies by desktop environment

### Color Recommendations
- Use 2-3 main colors maximum
- Ensure sufficient contrast (WCAG AA minimum)
- Consider colorblind users
- Test on both light and dark backgrounds

## Customizing Icons

To replace with your own design:

1. **Create Master Icon**
   - Design a 1024x1024 PNG with transparency
   - Save as `src-tauri/icons/icon-1024.png`

2. **Generate All Formats**
   ```bash
   npm run tauri:icon icons/icon-1024.png
   ```

3. **Update SVG (Optional)**
   - Edit `scripts/generate-icons.js`
   - Modify the `createSVGIcon()` function
   - Run `npm run icons:generate`

## Troubleshooting

### Icons not showing in app
- Clear build cache: `npm run clean`
- Rebuild: `npm run tauri:build`
- Check Tauri config references correct icon paths

### Conversion fails
- Install sharp-cli: `npm install -g sharp-cli`
- Or use ImageMagick: See installation instructions above
- Or use online converters and place PNG files manually

### Icons look blurry
- Ensure you're using PNG files, not SVG in final build
- Check that high-DPI versions (@2x) are generated
- Verify icon sizes match platform requirements

### macOS .icns generation fails
- Requires macOS with iconutil command
- Alternative: Use online converter like https://iconverticons.com
- Or build on macOS machine

## Production Checklist

Before releasing:

- [ ] Icons generated for all sizes
- [ ] icon.ico created for Windows
- [ ] icon.icns created for macOS
- [ ] Icons tested at all sizes (16x16 to 1024x1024)
- [ ] Icons visible on light and dark backgrounds
- [ ] System tray icon displays correctly
- [ ] App icon shows in taskbar/dock
- [ ] Installer icon displays correctly
